Title:
Global diversity and taxonomy of Sidera (Hymenochaetales,
Basidiomycota): seven new species and keys to species of the genus
Abstract:
The genus Sidera is a polypore genus with resupinate,
white to cream or buff fresh basidioma, poroid or hydnoid hymenophore, a
monomitic or dimitic hyphal system with generative hyphae bearing clamp
connections, the presence of rosette-like crys-tals, and allantoid to
lunate basidiospores. We study the phylogeny and diversity of Sidera
herein by using both morphological and molecular methods. Phylogenetic
anal-yses are based on a concatenated ITS+nLSU+RPB1+RPB2+TEF1+mtSSU+nSSU
se-quence data of 20 taxa of Sidera all over the world. Among these
seven species are new to science, viz.Â Sidera americana, S. inflata, S.
malaysiana, S. monomitica, S. pseudolenis, S. punctata and S.
qinlingensis. In addition, three taxa are treated as Sidera sp. New
species are all described and illustrated. An identification key to 17
accepted species of Sidera in worldwide is provided.
